definitions.definition: The water that runs through a millrace to power a mill.
A type of wild mountain goat of the genus Capra, such as the species Capra ibex.
A monocotyledonous plant (Allium cepa), allied to garlic, used as vegetable and spice.
The bulb of such a plant.
The genus as a whole.
A ball.
A person from Bermuda or of Bermudian descent.
A plant or flower of the genus Viola, especially the fragrant Viola odorata; (inexact) similar-looking plants and flowers.
A person thought to resemble V. odorata, especially in its beauty and delicacy.
A bluish-purple colour resembling that of most V. odorata.
Clothes and vestments of such a colour.
(perfumes) The characteristic scent of V. odorata.
Having a bluish-purple colour.
To move gently and vertically, in either a single motion or repeatedly up and down, at or near the surface of a body of water, or similar medium.
definitions.example: The ball, which we had thought lost, suddenly bobbed up out of the water.

definitions.definition: To move (something) as though it were bobbing in water.
definitions.example: I bobbed my head under water and saw the goldfish.

definitions.definition: To curtsy.
To strike with a quick, light blow; to tap.
To cut (hair) into a bob haircut.
definitions.example: I got my hair bobbed. How do you like it?

definitions.definition: To shorten by cutting; to dock; to crop
To bobsleigh.
A bomber crew member who sights and releases bombs.
A non-commissioned officer rank in artillery, equivalent to corporal. Abbreviated Bdr.
definitions.example: Wikipedia: Bombardier (Bdr) and Lance Bombardier (LBdr or L/Bdr) are British Army ranks used in the Royal Artillery and Royal Horse Artillery instead of (respectively) Corporal and Lance Corporal. In the Canadian Forces, the Artillery Branch uses the ranks of Master Bombardier and Bombardier instead of Master Corporal and Corporal.

definitions.definition: An artilleryman; a gunner.
A bombardier beetle.
The knowledge of one's own worth, valuing one's self; pride.
definitions.example: If you have no self-respect you can't respect others, because what value would you offer someone by giving the respect of one who is as lowly as you view yourself?

definitions.definition: A planting of shrubs; a wide border to a garden where shrubs are thickly planted; or a similar larger area with a path winding through it.
Shrubs collectively.
A trail or slope used for skiing
The names of animals that have red eyes.
Types of beverages.
(travel) An overnight airplane flight.
definitions.example: I waited too late to book my holiday flight, so I had to take the red-eye.

definitions.definition: Redness of the conjunctiva; especially when caused by conjunctivitis (pink-eye).
Redness in the eye(s) of someone in a colour photograph, as an unwanted consequence of light from a flash reflecting off blood vessels in the retina.
(travel) Often followed by it: to travel on a red-eye.
(plural: reindeer) Any Arctic and subarctic-dwelling deer of the species Rangifer tarandus, with a number of subspecies.
(plural: reindeers) Any species, subspecies, ecotype, or other scientific grouping of such animals.
The state or period of being a boy.
A serious infectious disease which causes inflammation of mucous membranes of the upper respiratory tract caused by Corynebacterium diphtheriae.
To attempt; to endeavour. Followed by infinitive.
definitions.example: I tried to rollerblade, but I couldn’t.

definitions.definition: To divide; to separate.
To test, to work out.
To experiment, to strive.
To lie to in heavy weather under just sufficient sail to head into the wind.
To strain; to subject to excessive tests.
definitions.example: Repeated failures try one's patience.

definitions.definition: (used with another verb) To want
definitions.example: I am really not trying to hear you talk about my mama like that.

definitions.definition: The act by which one tries something; an attempt.
Difficult to endure; arduous.
Irritating, stressful or bothersome.
A small chewy candy made with corn syrup, gelatin and some flavouring oils or powders.
(of a person) Aware of the socioeconomic class of oneself and others.
(of a community) Stratified into such classes.
A burn on the skin caused by excess exposure to the sun's rays.
A burn on the tissue of crop plants or their fruits (especially if they are rich in water like tomatoes, grapes, apples, gooseberries) caused by excess exposure to the sun's rays.
To receive a sunburn.
To burn or tan (someone's skin) by the sun; to allow (a part of one's body) to become sunburnt.
A tool for chopping wood; an axe/ax.
A knife for chopping food.
A crude tool with an irregular cutting edge formed by removing flakes from one side of a stone.
A thick mitten, usually with yellow leather on the outside.
The penis.
A type of road motorcycle, especially as used by biker/bikie gangs.
An assault rifle, especially a fully-automatic one (e.g. an AK-47).
Any of various electronic switches used to interrupt one signal under the control of another.
The bluefish (Pomatomus saltatrix).
A helicopter.
To travel or transport by helicopter.
To dismiss; to fire.
To power down, to switch off, to put out of operation, to deactivate (an appliance, light, mechanism, functionality etc.).
definitions.example: Turn off the machine and unplug it when you leave.

definitions.definition: To rotate a tap or valve so as to interrupt the outflow of liquid or gas.
definitions.example: Remember to turn the tap off once you've finished so you don't waste water.

definitions.definition: To repulse, disgust, or discourage (someone).
definitions.example: Cigarette smoking really turns me off.

definitions.definition: To leave a road; to exit.
definitions.example: Turn off at the next exit so we can have lunch.

definitions.definition: A person with an extraordinary intellect or skill that is markedly superior to his or her peers.
A person responsible for the highest level of planning and execution of a major operation.
To act in the role of mastermind.
That which causes wonder; a prodigy; a miracle.
Wonder, astonishment.
To become filled with wonderment or admiration; to be amazed at something.
To marvel at.
(used impersonally) To cause to marvel or be surprised.
Greater in amount, quantity, or number (of discrete objects, as opposed to more, which was applied to substances)
To a greater degree
Further, longer
(abbreviation) month
Moment
definitions.example: Hang on a mo!

definitions.definition: A homosexual
More
definitions.example: Yo, you got mo chips?

definitions.definition: A moustache
A molester.
Dirt, grease, soot, etc. that is ingrained and difficult to remove.
definitions.example: Underneath all that soot, dirt and grime is the true beauty of the church in soft shades of sandstone.

definitions.definition: A genre of urban music that emerged in London, England, in the early 2000s, primarily a development of UK garage, dancehall, and hip hop.
To begrime; to cake with dirt.
A large board that displays the score in a game or contest.
A similar board that also displays each batsman's score, and many statistics and pieces of information.
(by extension) A listing of various similar entities along with their properties, such as status or rank.
Characterized by rugged, sharp, or coarse features.
definitions.example: The goat climbed up the craggy rocks.

definitions.definition: A sarcastic expression of disbelief.
definitions.example: Your dog ate your homework? Yeah, right.

definitions.definition: Correct; affirmative; yes; yes, that is correct.
The process of checking out of a hotel, or the latest time to vacate a room in one.
The process of checking out items at a supermarket or library.
The place in a supermarket where this is done.
A test to see if some device is functioning properly.
An inspection or investigation.
A telephone containing a built-in device for recording incoming callers’ messages for later retrieval.
definitions.example: I keep trying to call her, but all I get is the answerphone.

definitions.definition: The act or process of infiltrating, as of water into a porous substance, or of a fluid into the cells of an organ or part of the body.
The substance which has entered the pores or cavities of a body.
The act of secretly entering a physical location and/or organization.
To include (something) as a part.
definitions.example: The design of his house incorporates a spiral staircase.

definitions.definition: To mix (something in) as an ingredient; to blend
definitions.example: Incorporate air into the mixture.

definitions.definition: To admit as a member of a company
To form into a legal company.
definitions.example: The company was incorporated in 1980.

definitions.definition: To include (another clause or guarantee of the US constitution) as a part (of the Fourteenth Amendment, such that the clause binds not only the federal government but also state governments).
To form into a body; to combine, as different ingredients, into one consistent mass.
To unite with a material body; to give a material form to; to embody.

Being a type of company, a legal entity where the ownership has been arranged into shares. A shareholder has no responsibilities to the company and the potential losses of the shareholder are limited to the value of the stock turning to zero in the case of a bankruptcy.
A stepfather.
A flat or roughly flat strip on the neck of a stringed instrument, against which the strings are pressed to shorten the vibrating length and produce notes of higher pitches.
A miniature skateboard that is driven with the fingers.
(slightly derogatory) A celebrity.
The act or process of consolidating, making firm, or uniting; the state of being consolidated
The combination of several actions into one.
A solidification into a firm dense mass. It is usually applied to induration (swelling or hardening of normally soft tissue) of a normally aerated lung.
A manager who works on the shop floor and may directly interact with customers.
One who manages the floor of a dance, club, or other gathering of people.
A manager of a television show, responsible for communication between the director and the crew.
A young person who is ugly, but who is expected to become beautiful as they mature.
In a passenger-only area of an airport (beyond passport and customs control)
definitions.example: When I was airside, I browsed the duty-free shops.

definitions.definition: Into the passenger-only area of an airport (beyond passport and customs control)
definitions.example: You have to go through security to go airside.

definitions.definition: Any family having one or more stepchildren or stepparents.
The family of one's stepfather or stepmother; those immediate family members not related by blood.
A person who suffers from paraplegia.
Of, related to, or suffering from paraplegia.
Half of a circle.
An instrument for measuring angles.
To try.
definitions.example: A group of 80 budding mountaineers attempted Kilimanjaro, but 30 of them didn't make it to the top.

definitions.definition: To try to move, by entreaty, by afflictions, or by temptations; to tempt.
To try to win, subdue, or overcome.
definitions.example: one who attempts the virtue of a woman

definitions.definition: To attack; to make an effort or attack upon; to try to take by force.
definitions.example: to attempt the enemy's camp

definitions.definition: Tried, with the connotation of failure.
definitions.example: An attempted coup.

definitions.definition: To comply with something, even if reluctantly; to accept or tolerate.
An electronic instrument that creates its sounds with electronics and has a keyboard.
An electronic instrument module that creates its sounds with electronics and does not have any keyboard.
An electronic circuit that generates an electronic signal oscillation with accurate timing from a reference oscillator.
An electronic device that generates electronic signal patterns to test an electronic circuit.
A person who accepts or champions nihilism.
An absolute skeptic; a person who believes in the truth of nothing.
Any substance, such as acetylcholine or dopamine, responsible for sending nerve signals across a synapse between two neurons.
To stop the flow of (blood).
To stop, check, or deter an action.
definitions.example: Somebody's got to staunch those press leaks!

definitions.definition: Loyal, trustworthy, reliable.
definitions.example: He's been a staunch supporter of mine through every election.

definitions.definition: Dependable, persistent.
definitions.example: Without our staunch front line the enemy would have split the regiment.

definitions.definition: Behind a vessel; having a bearing of 180 degrees from ahead.
definitions.example: If one ship is following another, the first is astern of the second.

definitions.definition: Behind (a vessel); in the rear.
In the direction of the stern; backward (motion); to the rear.
At or toward the rear of a vessel.
To place (objects) into a line (usually used with "up"); to form into a line; to align.
definitions.example: to line troops

definitions.definition: To place persons or things along the side of for security or defense; to strengthen by adding; to fortify.
definitions.example: to line works with soldiers

definitions.definition: To form a line along.
To mark with a line or lines, to cover with lines.
definitions.example: to line a copy book

definitions.definition: To represent by lines; to delineate; to portray.
To read or repeat line by line.
definitions.example: to line out a hymn

definitions.definition: To hit a line drive; to hit a line drive which is caught for an out. Compare fly and ground.
definitions.example: Jones lined to left in his last at-bat.

definitions.definition: To track (wild bees) to their nest by following their line of flight.
To measure.
To cover the inner surface of (something), originally especially with linen.
definitions.example: The bird lines its nest with soft grass.

definitions.definition: To reinforce (the back of a book) with glue and glued scrap material such as fabric or paper.
To fill or supply (something), as a purse with money.
definitions.example: to line the shelves

definitions.definition: (of a dog) To copulate with, to impregnate.
A covering for the inside surface of something.
The material used for such a covering.
The act of attaching such a covering.
Having nerve; bold; brazen.
Feeling nervous, anxious or agitated.
Strong; sinewy.
Jittery; having unwanted signal characteristics.
That which prefigures or appears to predict; a harbinger.
To show or suggest ahead of time; to represent beforehand (often used in a Biblical context).
To predict or foresee.
An item of play equipment that children can climb up and then slide down again.
definitions.example: The long, red slide was great fun for the kids.

definitions.definition: A surface of ice, snow, butter, etc. on which someone can slide for amusement or as a practical joke.
The falling of large amounts of rubble, earth and stones down the slope of a hill or mountain; avalanche.
definitions.example: The slide closed the highway.

definitions.definition: An inclined plane on which heavy bodies slide by the force of gravity, especially one constructed on a mountainside for conveying logs by sliding them down.
A mechanism consisting of a part which slides on or against a guide.
The act of sliding; smooth, even passage or progress.
definitions.example: a slide on the ice

definitions.definition: A lever that can be moved in two directions.
A valve that works by sliding, such as in a trombone.
A transparent plate bearing an image to be projected to a screen.
(by extension) A page of a computer presentation package such as PowerPoint.
definitions.example: I still need to prepare some slides for my presentation tomorrow.

definitions.definition: A flat, usually rectangular piece of glass or similar material on which a prepared sample may be viewed through a microscope Generally referred to as a microscope slide.
The act of dropping down and skidding into a base
(guitar) A hand-held device made of smooth, hard material, used in the practice of slide guitar.
A lively dance from County Kerry, in 12/8 time.
A small dislocation in beds of rock along a line of fissure.
A grace consisting of two or more small notes moving by conjoint degrees, and leading to a principal note either above or below.
A sound which, by a gradual change in the position of the vocal organs, passes imperceptibly into another sound.
A clasp or brooch for a belt, etc.
(footwear) A shoe that is backless and open-toed.
(speech therapy) A voluntary stutter used as a technique to control stuttering in one's speech.
Agent noun of slide: one who slides.
A sliding door.
A pitch thrown with added pressure by middle and ring fingers yielding a combination of backspin and sidespin, resulting in a motion to the left when thrown by a right handed pitcher.
A similar delivery in which the wrist and ring finger work to impart backspin to the ball.
A small hamburger.
definitions.example: We ordered five sliders.

definitions.definition: A piece of Teflon or similar material attached to a curling shoe that allows the player to slide along the ice.
The movable part of a zip fastener that opens or closes the row of teeth.
A widget allowing the user to select a value or position on a sliding scale.
A slideshow on a web page.
The red-bellied terrapin (Pseudemys rubriventris, syn. Pseudemys rugosa).
(skydiving) A rectangle of fabric that helps produce an orderly parachute deployment.
An open-toed and backless sandal
Of words, an idea, etc.: to go unheeded.
A short circuit.
A short film.
A short version of a garment in a particular size.
definitions.example: 38 short suits fit me right off the rack.

definitions.definition: A shortstop.
definitions.example: Jones smashes a grounder between third and short.

definitions.definition: A short seller.
definitions.example: The market decline was terrible, but the shorts were buying champagne.

definitions.definition: A short sale.
definitions.example: He closed out his short at a modest loss after three months.

definitions.definition: A summary account.
A short sound, syllable, or vowel.
An integer variable having a smaller range than normal integers; usually two bytes long.
An automobile; especially in crack shorts, to break into automobiles.
To cause a short circuit in (something).
Of an electrical circuit, to short circuit.
To shortchange.
To provide with a smaller than agreed or labeled amount.
definitions.example: This is the third time I’ve caught them shorting us.

definitions.definition: To sell something, especially securities, that one does not own at the moment for delivery at a later date in hopes of profiting from a decline in the price; to sell short.
To shorten.
Trousers worn primarily in warm weather that do not go lower than the knees.
definitions.example: Jessica hated covering her legs, so she usually wore shorts.

definitions.definition: Underwear bottoms.
definitions.example: After a scare like that, I need to change my shorts.

definitions.definition: Remnants, clippings, trimmings of production processes.
The part of milled grain sifted out which is next finer than the bran; pollard.
Short, inferior hemp.
(chiefly in plural) A demographic criterion: a characteristic used to classify people for statistical purposes, such as age, race, or gender.
A demographic group: a collection of people sharing a value for a certain demographic criterion.
An individual person's characteristic, encoded for the purposes of statistical analysis.
Of or pertaining to demography.
A small off-road four-wheeled powered vehicle, especially of a design derived from a motorcycle, usually used for recreation or farm work.
One of the two parts of a parliament in some countries.
A large, three masted, square rigged sailing ship with at least two decks.
A frequency or rate.

A move which is part of one's own plan or strategy and forces, e.g. by means of a check or attacking a piece, the opponent to make a move which is not bad but of no use for him (the player gains a tempo, the opponent loses a tempo), or equivalently a player achieves the same result in fewer moves by one approach rather than another.
The timing advantage of being on lead, thus being first to initiate a strategy to develop tricks for one's side.
The timing of a particular event – earlier or later than in an alternative situation (as in chess example)
The number of beats per minute in a piece of music; also, an indicative term denoting approximate rate of speed in written music (examples: allegro, andante)
The steady pace set by the frontmost riders.

A small truck or cargo van with three or four wheels, commonly used for commercial transport and deliveries (particularly in Asian and African countries): a genericized trademark, originally associated with the manufacturer Vidal & Sohn Tempo-Werke GmbH.
A rapid rate of play by the offense resulting from reducing the amount of time which elapses after one play ends and the next starts.
A signal fire to notify of the approach of an enemy, or to give any notice, commonly of warning.
A signal or conspicuous mark erected on an eminence near the shore, or moored in shoal water, as a guide to mariners.
A high hill or other easily distinguishable object near the shore which can serve as guidance for seafarers.
That which gives notice of danger, or keeps people on the correct path.
An electronic device that broadcasts a signal to nearby portable devices, enabling smartphones etc. to perform actions when in physical proximity to the beacon.
To act as a beacon.
To give light to, as a beacon; to light up; to illumine.
To furnish with a beacon or beacons.
To supply electricity to; to charge with electricity.

definitions.definition: To cause electricity to pass through; to affect by electricity; to give an electric shock to.
definitions.example: to electrify a limb, or the body

definitions.definition: To adapt (a home, farm, village, city, industry, railroad) for electric power.
To strongly excite, especially by something delightful or inspiring; to thrill.
definitions.example: Her performance in the play electrified the audience.

definitions.definition: To become electric.
Relating to, or characterized by, craft or skill; dexterous.
Possessing dexterity; skilled; skillful.
Skillful at deceiving others; characterized by craft

An official providing honorable service in a royal or high noble household, ranking between a squire and a page. Especially, a Yeoman of the Guard, a member of a ceremonial bodyguard to the UK monarch (not to be confused with a Yeoman Warder).
A dependable, diligent, or loyal worker or someone who does a great service.
A former class of small freeholders who farm their own land; a commoner of good standing.
A subordinate, deputy, aide, or assistant.
A Yeoman Warder.
A clerk in the US Navy, and US Coast Guard.
In a vessel of war, the person in charge of the storeroom.
A member of the Yeomanry Cavalry, officially chartered in 1794 originating around the 1760s.
A member of the Imperial Yeomanry, officially created in 1890s and renamed in 1907.
Any of various nymphalid butterflies of the genus Cirrochroa, of Asia and Australasia.
Inducing fear or nervousness; frequently used of a work of fiction.
definitions.example: The children's mother was worried that the spine-chilling ghost film would give them nightmares.

definitions.definition: Fine print
To be in battle or in a rivalry with another for the same thing, position, or reward; to contend
To be in a position in which it is possible to win or triumph.
To take part in a contest, game or similar event
Being in the state of competition (often unintentionally).
The presence of one or more disorders (or diseases) in addition to a primary disease or disorder.
definitions.example: Extensive comorbidity is the hallmark of immunodeficiencies.

definitions.definition: A disease thus coexisting.
definitions.example: Coronary artery disease is often a comorbidity of diabetes mellitus.

definitions.definition: The effect of such additional disorders or diseases.
A lack of adequate nourishment.
The art or act of cultivating; improvement of land for or by agriculture
definitions.example: The heavy cultivation of the hillside led to soil erosion.

definitions.definition: The state of being cultivated or used for agriculture
definitions.example: These fields are in cultivation.

definitions.definition: Devotion of time or attention to the improvement of (something)
definitions.example: His steadfast cultivation of their relationship finally bore fruit.

definitions.definition: Advancement or refinement in physical, intellectual, or moral condition
definitions.example: She is a woman of great cultivation.

definitions.definition: Time for play or diversion.
A time when children can play outside during the school day.
definitions.example: The school bell rings to mark the end of playtime.

definitions.definition: A duration of time when one is not as serious as they could be, especially in a conflict of sorts.
definitions.example: I thought I could go easy on you and win, but I suppose playtime is over.

definitions.definition: The duration of a recording.
definitions.example: The longest track on the album has a playtime of eight minutes.

definitions.definition: A selfish or excessive desire for more than is needed or deserved, especially of money, wealth, food, or other possessions.
definitions.example: His greed was his undoing.

definitions.definition: To desire in a greedy manner, or to act on such a desire.
To have or express an opinion; to state as an opinion; to suppose, consider (that).
definitions.example: "Your decisions," she opined, "have been unfailingly disastrous for this company."

definitions.definition: To give one's formal opinion (on or upon something).
definitions.example: I had to opine on the situation because I thought a different perspective was in order.

definitions.definition: Any of a class of organic compounds, derived from amino acids, found in some plant tumours
A card game with many rule variants, conceptually similar to mahjong.
A rum-drinking alcoholic.
Resembling or tasting of rum.
definitions.example: a rummy flavour

definitions.definition: Peculiar; odd.
A lettuce cultivar (Lactuca sativa var. capitata) noted for its crunchiness; the most familiar of all lettuces sold in the United States.
So unpleasant or painful as to be unendurable
A carved figure on the prow of a sailing ship.
(by extension) Someone in a nominal position of leadership who has no actual power; a front or front man.
A drug that numbs the pain in the body.
To cut trees into logs.
To cut down (trees).
To cut down trees in an area, harvesting and transporting the logs as wood.
To make, to add an entry (or more) in a log or logbook.
definitions.example: to log the miles travelled by a ship

definitions.definition: To travel (a distance) as shown in a logbook
To travel at a specified speed, as ascertained by chip log.
To move to and fro; to rock.
An act or instance of logging (cutting trees).
An act or instance of logging (making an entry in a log).
Moving, sloping or oriented downward.
definitions.example: He spoke with a downward glance.

definitions.definition: Located at a lower level.
Toward a lower level, whether in physical space, in a hierarchy, or in amount or value.
definitions.example: His position in society moved ever downward.

definitions.definition: At a lower level.
Southward
Inclined to drowse; heavy with sleepiness
definitions.example: I was feeling drowsy and so decided to make a cup of coffee to try to wake myself up.

definitions.definition: Causing someone to fall sleep or feel sleepy; lulling; soporific.
definitions.example: It was a warm, drowsy summer afternoon.

definitions.definition: Boring.
Dull; stupid.
Not showing due respect; impertinent; bold-faced.
definitions.example: The impudent children would not stop talking in class.

definitions.definition: An act of expressing dissent, especially spoken.
Strong disagreement; a contention or quarrel; discord.
One of a series of berths or beds placed in tiers.
A built-in bed on board ship, often erected in tiers one above the other.
A cot.
A wooden case or box, which serves for a seat in the daytime and for a bed at night.
A piece of wood placed on a lumberman's sled to sustain the end of heavy timbers.
To occupy a bunk.
To provide a bunk.
Bunkum; senseless talk, nonsense.
Defective, broken, not functioning properly
To fail to attend school or work without permission; to play truant (usually as in 'to bunk off').
To expel from a school.
